raw_text:
Injury sidelines Philippoussis
 
 Mark Philippoussis withdrew from the Sydney International tennis tournament as expected on Sunday after suffering a groin injury during the Hopman Cup.
 
 His participation in the Australian Open, which begins on 17 January in Melbourne, also remains in doubt. Defending women's champion Justine Henin-Hardenne is also out of the Sydney event because of a knee injury. In the only main draw men's or women's singles match on Sunday, Nathalie Dechy beat American Lisa Raymond 7-5 6-3. Number one men's seed Lleyton Hewitt begins his quest for a fourth Sydney title on Tuesday when he plays Karol Beck. Lindsay Davenport, top seed in the women's draw, has been handed a first-round bye and plays France's Dechy in the second round on Tuesday.
llama3.2:1b:
Mark Philippoussis withdrew from the Sydney International due to a groin injury.
His participation in the Australian Open is also uncertain.
Justine Henin-Hardenne is out of the event due to a knee injury.
Nathalie Dechy beat Lisa Raymond 7-5 6-3 in one of the main draw matches.
Lleyton Hewitt will play Karol Beck on Tuesday for his Sydney title bid.
Lindsay Davenport has been given a first-round bye and will play Dechy in the second round.

Lindsay Davenport receives a first-round bye and will play Dechy in the second round.

Lindsay Davenport has been given a first-round bye and will play France's Dechy in the second round of that match, while top seed Lindsay Davenport faces her former partner Dechy in the women's draw against French player Karol Beck on Tuesday.

qwen2.5:3b: Mark Philippoussis withdrew from the Sydney International due to a groin injury. The Australian Open starts January 17 in Melbourne, with his participation uncertain. Justine Henin-Hardenne is also absent due to a knee injury. Nathalie Dechy defeated Lisa Raymond in a single match. Lleyton Hewitt and Lindsay Davenport compete in upcoming matches.
opencoder:1.5b: Mark Philippoussis, a former Australian tennis player who suffered from a groin injury at the Sydney International Tennis Tournament, withdraws as expected due to his injury. While he participated in the Australian Open, he is uncertain about the next part of the season. Defending champion Justine Henin-Hardenne is also out of the Sydney event due to an additional injury, a knee injury. In the main draw for men's or women's singles match on Sunday, Nathalie Dechy defeated America Lisa Raymond 7-5 6-3. Lleyton Hewitt, in his quest for the fourth Sydney title, also starts on Tuesday and plays Karol Beck. Lindsay Davenport, a top seed in the draw, has been bailed out due to a first-round bye and plays France's Dechy in the second round on Tuesday.

tinyllama:1.1b: Mark Philippoussis, withdrawn from the Sydney International tennis tournament after suffering a groin injury during the Hopman Cup, is expected to not participate in the Australian Open that starts on 17 January in Melbourne. Despite recovering from an earlier knee injury, defending women's champion Justin Henin-Hardenne also did not enter the main draw due to a torn right knee ligament. Top men's seed Lleyton Heatherbe plays Karol Beck first and Lindsey Davenport receives a bye in the women's draw. Number one ranked men's player Lleyton Heathwaite will compete in the second round, facing France's Decchy on 18 January.

His participation in the Australian Open remains uncertain. Defending women's champion Justine Henin-Hardenne is out of the tournament for knee injuries. In the only main draw men's or women's singles match, Nathalie Dechy defeated Lisa Raymond 7-5 and 6-3. Lleyton Hewitt begins his quest for a fourth Sydney title on Tuesday when he plays Karol Beck in the first round.
